main event: On July 21, 1952 in Lincoln, Nebraska, a civilian reported a sighting of a silvery, round object, the size of a softball, moving at a high rate of speed from the SW to the NE for 15 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as spinning and appeared to be the size of a silver dollar.
It was observed in clear sky conditions with no reported thunderstorm activity.
There were no photographs of the object included in the report.
The report was submitted in compliance with certain Air Force regulations.
The non-technical background of the observer was mentioned as making it difficult for them to identify the precise appearance of the object.
